did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell University Africana Studies and Research Center records, 1969-1976.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Cornell University.Africana Studies and Research Center.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Contains course syllabi for courses taught in the 1970s.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Africana Studies and Research Center was formally the Afro-American Studies Center.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Publicity items, history, lectures, and other ephemera relating to the center and Africana studies. Contains course syllabi for courses taught in the 1970s.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Africana Studies and Research Center records, #53-1-3363. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Series I. Publicity

An Intro to Modern African Political Systems- Tendai Mutunhu: Swahili Literature- Willie Kamera

Politics and Black Community Organization- James Turner; Infancy, Family and the Community- Dalton Jones
Black American Writing and Politics- J. Mayfield; Advanced Seminar in Total Black Theatre- C. Everett
Ideology and Development in East Africa; Contemporary African History- John Higginson
History of Afro-American Literature- Bell; Black Politics and the American Political System; The Political Economy of Black America- Bailey
Themes in African History- Mbata; Slave Trade of Africans- Mutunhu; Blacks in Communication Media and Film Workshop- Gibbons and Bourne
Political History of Social Development- Riviere; Political Ideology, Planning and Development in Africa- Folson
